text: I think I was very lucky overall in how
the incident played out I think I was
unlucky to intersect with this violent
mentally ill guy but I also think that
the fact that this incident has had
relatively few severe consequences
points to it as an example of kind of a
successful humane society operating a
sane society why this ill man mr. Meyer
only had access to a bread knife to
attack me with he didn't have access to
firearms and that's due in large part to
the UK's very successful gun control
policy because if it had been in America
for example things could have been very
different in America when in a lot of
other countries if there are a lot of
armed people around it's very likely
that the assailant gets killed
some people would say that the fact that
you've been attacked by a man with a
knife in a tube station early on
Saturday evening shows what a dangerous
society we're living in these kinds of
events are really really rare in our
society it seems to me that the people
who have had significantly tragic
outcomes from this incident are mostly
mr. Meyer and his family and I've feel
nothing but pity for them that's very
generous of you isn't it
I just don't think he's a very well man
I've never connected this with either
mr. Meyer or my own community
backgrounds or religion what do you
remember about that evening not very
much
I was about to exit the tube and I
remember something shocking happening
but I don't remember it exactly what the
shocking event was and I remember being
punched and kicked on the ground and
then I lost consciousness
and then found myself being looked after
expertly by a junior doctor what about
your throat being slashed I was asleep
for that because your throat was slashed
three times I see in the medical reports
that there are there were three wounds
to my neck and how are you now I'm
recovering pretty well I've never felt
traumatized by the event the scar on my
throat is easy to ignore your attacker
has now been convicted and of course he
hasn't been sent to prison he's been
sent to a place which will look after
him from a mental health point of view
what do you think about that I think
that's by far the most just and humane
thing to happen to him that's also an
environment where a he can be safe from
society and society can be safe from him
I'm not at all interested in retribution
or having him be punished for his mental
illness
